mode.description: indicates that the sucessful request was of the type activate immediate

scheduled_time.description: String formatted TAI timestamp (<seconds>:<nanoseconds>) indicating absolute time at which activation was actually completed. This should be the point at which the parameters of the sender/receiver have been configured, but may be before any packets have been received or sent.

code.description: Status of activation represented by an HTTP status code. This may be used to check the status of the latest activation

oneOf.description: Describes parameters for a sucessful scheduled activation. This may be returned when the scheduled time for the activation has passed and the sender/receiver parameters have been updated sucessfully. This may be before any packets are sent or received.
oneOf.title: Activation object

mode.description: mode of activation: immediate (on message rx), scheduled_absolute (when internal clock >= requested_time), scheduled_relative (when internal clock >= time of message rx + requested_time). activate_scheduled* must only be used with a code of 200 if the scheduled time has passed and the sender/receiver has been successfully configured with the new parameters

scheduled_time.description: String formatted TAI timestamp (<seconds>:<nanoseconds>) indicating absolute time at which activation was completed. This should be the point at which the parameters of the sender/receiver have been configured, but may be before any packets have been received or sent.

requested_time.description: String formatted TAI timestamp (<seconds>:<nanoseconds>) indicating requested time (absolute or relative) for activation

code.description: Status of activation represented by an HTTP status code. This may be used to check the status of the latest activation

oneOf.description: Describes parameters for scheduled connection activation which has yet to occur
oneOf.title: Activation object

mode.description: mode of activation: immediate (on message rx), scheduled_absolute (when internal clock >= requested_time), scheduled_relative (when internal clock >= time of message rx + requested_time)

requested_time.description: String formatted TAI timestamp (<seconds>:<nanoseconds>) indicating requested time (absolute or relative) for activation

scheduled_time.description: String formatted TAI timestamp (<seconds>:<nanoseconds>) indicating absolute time at which activation was scheduled. This is calculated as time of reception of request + requested_time). Note that if the requested time is already passed the activation should be carried out imediately and the schema for a 200 response should be used instead.

code.description: status of activation represented by an HTTP status code. For scheduled activations this will change from 202 to 200 after activation is completed.
